title: Girl, 4, and her brother, 8, found hanged in basement together
text:
Two children were found hanged together in a Berks County, Pennsylvania home (Picture: CBS)

A mother discovered her four-year-old daughter and her eight-year-old son hanged together in the basement of their home.

Conner Snyder and Brinley Snyder were unresponsive by the time they were found by their mother Lisa Snyder in Albany Township, Pennsylvania last month.

The children were revived by paramedics while on the way to the hospital. They were placed on life support, but died three days later.

Now, police are investigating what led the the horrific incident at the Snyder’s home.

Investigators have filed search warrants to analyze Connor Snyder’s Xbox video game console, a cellphone, two iPads, and a laptop, according to Morning Call.

The children were found by their mother in the basement of their Berks County Home. (Picture: ABC News)

The warrant says: ‘The eight-year-old victim is known to play video games and view various internet websites utilizing the X-Box gaming console.’

Investigators are also looking for a dog that used to live in the home after taking an item related to the pet as a key piece of evidence. One detective wrote that he wants to weigh the dog, which was reportedly a husky-pitbull mix.

‘Determining the dog’s actual weight and size utilizing a scale will assist in the criminal investigation,’ the warrant said.

Berks County District Attorney John Adams told Morning Call: ‘Whenever we are dealing with the unnatural death of a child, it is very emotionally troubling to all of us.’

‘I believe to have two children perish in the same incident really compounds our concerns and we are looking forward to having some answers. But we need to take our time to determine exactly what happened.’

‘I think it’s going to take some time to get to the bottom of this,’ he later said.
